content.question: Which of the following best explains the symbiotic relationship between the coral and the algae?

choices.label: The relationship is an example of commensalism because the algae add <math alttext="C O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>CO</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub></math> to the oceans and the coral use <math alttext="C O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>CO</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub></math>.
The relationship is an example of commensalism because the coral provide shelter for the algae and the algae provide chlorophyll to the coral.
The relationship is an example of mutualism because the coral use sugars made by the algae and provide shelter for the algae.
The relationship is an example of mutualism because the algae perform photosynthesis for the coral and the coral perform respiration for the algae.

content.answer: The relationship is an example of mutualism because the coral use sugars made by the algae and provide shelter for the algae.

skill.text: 1.C: Explain biological concepts and processes in applied contexts.
